thread.title: Children among three injured after car flips onto Sydney footpath
thread.title_full: Children among three injured after car flips onto Sydney footpath

title: Children among three injured after car flips onto Sydney footpath
text:
Woman fights for life after car flips onto Sydney footpath and hits pram By 9NEWS Police believe a driver may have suffered a medical episode. (Supplied) 
A woman is fighting for her life after a car mounted the pavement and flipped onto its side near a popular shopping centre in Chatswood on Sydney’s North Shore. 
The car hit a woman near the corner of Archer Street and Victoria Avenue, across the road from the Chatswood Chase shopping centre, around 8.30am. 
https://twitter.com/iFLYflat/status/834885679851065344 
She was treated for serious head injuries at the scene before being taken to Royal North Shore Hospital where she is in a critical condition. 
In a lucky escape, a pram was only swiped by the car, and police were told a child sitting inside it was not injured. Family members are taking the child to their GP as a precaution. 
Paramedics earlier reported two children were involved in the crash. 
The driver of the car, a 67-year-old man, was treated at the scene for minor injuries. He will undergo mandatory blood and urine testing. 
Police said it is believed a driver suffered a medical episode. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
